data.title: Wealden Community Care
data.meta_description: Getting help in East Sussex - Find local groups and services to support you, your family and friends.
data.text:
The Care Quality Commission (CQC) is the independent regulator of health and adult social care in England.

The CQC makes sure health and social care services provide people with safe, effective, compassionate, high-quality care and we encourage care services to improve. Some services in England such as care homes, ambulances, GPs etc, are required to be registered.

Their role is to check whether hospitals, care homes, GPs, dentists, and care services delivered in your home are meeting national standards. They do this by monitoring, inspecting and regulating services and publishing what they find. Where they find poor care, they will use their powers to take action.
